moves.1. d4:
Hi everyone,

This has been a day of two halves for me.  It was a cloudy morning which matched my results.  I found myself writing resignation notes to two opponents, one of them Master Freddy in this game today.  I decide to kick off with 1. d4.
moves.1... Nc6 2. Nf3 d6 3. e4: 3. e4 - trying to consolidate in the centre.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Nc3: 4. Nc3 - all four knights developed.  It is a bit like a Pirc Defense.
moves.7. O-O Bg7 8. e5: 8. e5 - maybe Re1 might have been stronger here.
moves.10... Qxd6 11. c3: 11. c3 - closes off the diagonal of Freddy's dsb.
moves.16... e5 17. dxe5 fxe5: 17. ...... fxe5 - pawn trade.  Freddy now says that I must beware of his pawn centre.
moves.18. f3 h5 19. Nf1: 19. Nf1 - freeing up Fou Lenoir and adding a defense to my pawn on g3.
moves.19... c6 20. Bg5: 20. Bg5 - Fou Lenoir develops to g5 now that the f pawn has moved to the e column and the h pawn has advanced from h6.  The rooks are now connected.
moves.20... Bd3 21. Rad1 e4 22. fxe4 dxe4: 22. .... dxe4 - Freddy's pawn centre has been broken but that e pawn is gonna be awkward.
moves.24... Rf5 25. Nh2: 25. Nh2 - here Freddy suggests that g4 would have been better.
moves.25... Rfb5 26. g4 Rb5xb2 27. Rxb2 Rxb2 2: 28. ....... gxh5 - after the dust has settled, although I have exchanged off my weakie double ton on the g column I have lost my b2 pawn.  Now my a2 pawn is about to go caput.
moves.29. Rc1 Rxa2 30. Nf1: 30. Nf1 - becoming short of good moves here.
moves.30... Be5 31. Nd2 Rb2 32. Kf2 a5: 32. ..... a5 - Freddy's a passer is very formidable and dangerous indeed.
moves.33. Ke1 Bg3+: 33. ....... Bg3+ - Freddy puts the squeeze on.
moves.34. Kd1 Ra2 35. Bg5: 35. Bg5 - I'm very near to zugzwang her.
moves.35... Bf2 36. Bf4 e3: 36. ....e3 - the killer, the only way to avoid getting Freddied by e2# is to give up Fou Lenoir.  I wave the white flag, little did I know that a few hours later I would be presented with a ray of hope ......
